ratings.comment: I attended every lecture. He is very knowledgeable and knows how to teach. He is humorous and friendly. He is open to questions and will answer your questions patiently, and won't let you feel bad. Provides you with a categorical point of view, introduces you the modern algebra. I'm afraid I've left too much unsaid, but I am out of space.

A phenomenal professor! Very clear and provides plenty of motivation! Couldn't wait for the lectures every week because I was learning so much in each of them! 

Also, he engages you as a student by asking questions and inviting participation. I think it's the ideal way to teach a course, though it takes a very capable professor to teach this way.

Dima is one of the nicest profs in the math dept. Hes passionate about algebra, and hes fun and engaging, both in office hours and lecture. His exams can be tough, but he gives big hints and useful practice problems. Overall would recommend.

Very friendly and helpful.  I struggled with the class but that was of my own fault, as Dima gives you everything you need to succeed in the class.  Tough exams, but the practice tests are EXTREMELY similar to them, so you know exactly what to expect.  Does lots of examples and will keep explaining things in different ways if you don't understand.
Awesome prof. One of my favorite professors. Go to office hours. He is very patient when it comes to answering questions. Recommend to anyone who needs to take 222.

This man is absolutely brilliant.  Any struggles I had in this class had little to nothing to do with him.  His tests were not the easiest, but his practice exams were very similar and doing them helps a lot.  Do what I didn't and go to office hours and work with friends.  I absolutely despised this class but I loved Dima as the professor.

Dima might be one of the coolest professors on this campus. He knows all of the stuff very well and explains it great. In my class we had one kid all year questioning him everyday about his work and asking him to prove things. Dima's so chill he put up with it every time 10/10 wish Dima was my dad.

First time teaching 222 but did very well. DID give an extensive amount of examples. Made a couple of concepts harder than they could've been but a good TA  and friends never hurt. Exams just like final. Minimal HW (due weekly). Had his funny moments.  Very personable. Go to office hours. Textbook only used for HW problems.  Wants you to succeed!

Dima teaches theories and tests your understanding of concepts, rather than straight plug & chug. He also provides few examples and often goes on tangents during lectures. This made the course extremely difficult, personally. I wrote down a conversion wrong and didnt realize it until a few days before the final because he never showed examples.
Dmytro  is an amazing instructor because his explanations are in depth and are very clear. However, he doesn't give examples in the class and his explanations are very theoretical.

Dima is a good professor. He definitely knows what he is talking about and can explain it well in lecture. He is a bit more conceptual in lecture and will not do example after example, which for some people is definitely a plus. I could understand him at all times. He also seemed receptive and open to all questions in lecture. I didn't attend OH.

I felt as if i learned the material well from lectures (with little help from discussion), however, even though I felt like i knew everything pretty well, the tests were extremely difficult. We were given questions we've never seen before. He was a good professor but tests were difficult. Slight accent but still easy to understand.

Dima's a nice guy who knows his stuff, but he throws material on tests that you've never seen before. Homework was graded harshly and the exams were so much harder than the practice tests he would provide you. Heavy curve at the end though.

He is a good lecturer who does a good job at making some pretty difficult material approachable to undergrads. He did have one unit of material which was not found in the book, making it difficult to find a good reference outside of class for those concepts.
He is clear through his practice tests on what he expects you to know. The curve was also very generous in my class.

I absolutely loved Professor Arinkin! The lectures could be a bit boring and long (I mean, it is math.) but he was a great lecturer! He's really funny and his accent is a bonus for me haha I've only been to office hours once, but he was willing to help, and even agreed to meet me early I wish he taught more classes that I need to take for my major!
Dima was a great professor for this class, definitely one of the better professors. He's a really nice guy and grades fairly.

Excellent lecturer!  He would constantly ask the class if what he said made sense and if there were any questions.  Lectures were very informative and quite funny at times.  Doing the weekly homework is very easy and helpful.  The exams are pretty easy except for the last question is normally a little challenging.

He is really engaging; kept me focused for a power lecture. His accent is cool too. It reminds me of a Russian Mario.  Calc. 3 is a tough class but Professor Arinkin really helps you visualize everything.  Rather than just copy from the textbook he does examples that help master concepts.  Really smart and quirky dude.

Overall, a very good professor.  I thought he presented the material clearly and he was engaging, given it was a 75 min. lecture.  I really enjoyed how he began each lecture with a 5-10 min. recap of the important topics from the previous lecture.  Exams were somewhat difficult but were similar to the provided practice exams.

He is a good lecturer that explains things clearly and knows what he is talking about, and can make the class laugh now and then. The tests are moderately hard, but are very close to the practice exams. Small mistakes can cost you big though. If you have a good TA , it will help make things more clear. He also has an accent, but it's understandable
Great professor with engaging lectures. Explains everything clearly and teaches so you will be prepared for exams.

Class is challenging, but fair. Homework from the text book is often times unhelpful, but the practice tests he gives are good. He teaches toward the test, and teaches at a very reasonable pace. Also, a funny guy that makes things more understandable in laymen terms.

Awesome professor. Extremely helpful and clear both in lecture and office hours. Exams are very close to samples. Homework problems were somewhat difficult but class was enjoyable with him. Found free legal pdf of our textbook.
I loved taking his class he made math power lectures enjoyable with his enthusiasm and clarity

Excellent professor and very entertaining! I come from a foreign background so maybe I could understand him more than other but he certainly went over the material well and covered the topics that would be on exams. His exams on the difficult side, especially when compared to homework. Dont be suprised by a proof on the last page! Great professor!
He just makes this ultimate calculus class nice and easy. The homework has everything to do with the exams. He also makes the lecture funny and informative. Great prof.
I really liked this professor! He's really funny, but definitely look at the examples in the book too. If you do the homework and pay attention in lecture, you should get a good grade.
Lectures were well organized, but material was difficult and they were not overly helpful. Very nice guy, and he tries to keep the class engaged during difficult sections.
Lectures aren't very helpful. He goes over mostly the same thing, but at least he gives you practice exams similar to the real exams and the class isn't too much work.
